title: Mango farmers stage protest demanding payment of dues from pulp industries
content: Over 300 mango farmers participate in the ‚ÄúChalo Collectorate‚Äù programme in Chittoor; allege that some industries paid only ‚Çπ2-‚Çπ5 per kg so far, as against the government‚Äôs assurance of ‚Çπ8

title: Second phase of magisterial inquiry into Maredumilli encounters on December 27
content: Hyderabad-based advocate permitted to conduct fact-finding at encounter sites under police supervision, says Sub-Collector

title: Mob lynching: govt. promises justice, protection for victim‚Äôs family
content: There will be no compromise in investigation. Not a single person involved will be spared, says Revenue Minister K. Rajan

title: Watch: Kerala lynching triggers political outrage over Dalit migrant worker killing
content: The lynching of Dalit migrant labourer Ram Narayan Bhagal in Kerala‚Äôs Palakkad district has triggered strong reactions from political leaders. The Chief Minister, Opposition leaders and Left parties condemned the killing, calling it a blot on Kerala‚Äôs humanist legacy.

title: Doctor assaults patient at Shimla hospital; probe ordered as video sparks protest
content: Rahul Rao, Medical Superintendent of the hospital, said action against the accused doctor has been initiated and a report has been sought; Further action will be taken after the report is received, he added

title: Court begins hearing on private complaint on road rage case involving former Mayor and KSRTC driver
content: The court sends notices to Arya, her husband, Sachin Dev, MLA and others following a petition accusing the police of exonerating them of the offence

title: Boom to bust: how 2025 crushed Madanapalle‚Äôs tomato fortunes
content: Extreme weather, wild price swings and shrinking yields turned Asia‚Äôs largest tomato belt from a profit centre into a year-long struggle for farmers and traders across Rayalaseema

title: Delhi HC protects actor R. Madhavan‚Äôs personality rights, orders takedown of objectionable content from Internet
content: The court also restrained several defendants from using the personality traits of Madhavan through the use of artificial intelligence and deepfake technology

title: Congress strangled Constitution by imposing Emergency during Vande Mataram centenary: CM Adityanath
content: Yogi Adityanath said the respect for Vande Mataram is not merely an emotional expression it also instils in all of us a sense of our national duties towards constitutional values

title: CRDA clears ‚Çπ2,015 crore worth projects for Amaravati
content: 56th CRDA meeting chaired by Chief Minister sanctions funds for LPS-8 layouts, flood pumping station, All India Services officers‚Äô quarters and Quantum Computing Research Centre; high-level panel to examine jareebu (fertile or irrigated) and metta (dry) lands given by farmers

title: Assam on high alert after fresh unrest in Bangladesh: Himanta
content: It is well known that people from Bangladesh entered Assam at different times, and the State is ‚Äúfull of these people, the Chife Minister said on December 22

title: Surat court stays Jain girl‚Äôs ‚Äòdiksha‚Äô after father moves plea
content: On December 10, the girl's father had approached the family court seeking her custody, claiming his estranged wife had decided against his wishes that the child should take 'diksha' to become a monk

title: How Tamil sci-fi writers are bringing science closer to children
content: New-age Tamil authors writing for children have been consciously working towards making the genre more accessible

title: CPI accuses EC of advantaging the BJP by deleting secular votes en masse in key Assembly constituencies¬†in Kerala
content: Thousands of secular voters deleted in Kazhakuttom (43,395 deleted votes), Vattiyurkavu (54,000), Nemom (49,000), Attingal (16,000), Kattakada (22,233), and Manalur (20,000), among other Assembly segments, according to Binoy Viswam.

title: Goa nightclub fire: Police remand of Luthra siblings extended by five days
content: The siblings had fled to Thailand after the incident and were deported from that nation on December 17.

title: Santa, stars and sparkling trees drive sales in Broadway while garments left in the cold this Christmas
content: While firms dealing in Christmas decorations in Broadway have remained open until midnight and beyond, thanks to brisk sales, garment retailers are struggling, reporting a 40% drop in sales compared to last year.¬†

title: Bengaluru police integrate with Uber, Ola apps for real-time emergency support
content: According to Bengaluru City Police Commissioner, new integration allows emergency call facilities to be accessed directly from the Uber and Ola mobile applications used for booking rides

title: Search operation widened to track down terrorists hiding in forest belt in J&K's Udhampur
content: ‚ÄúThe cordon and search operation, which entered its second day, was launched in Majalta forests after two terrorists reportedly took food from a house before escaping into the nearby forest area,‚Äù says officials

title: Dalit migrant workers‚Äô lynching leaves Kerala aghast and draws across-the-aisle political condemnation
content: CPI(M) State Secretary M.V. Govindan blamed the RSS for the killing.¬†CPI State secretary Binoy Viswam accuses the Congress-led UDF of being ‚Äúsuspiciously coy‚Äù about calling out the RSS for Ram Narayan‚Äôs killing.

title: Only those making provocative speeches oppose anti-hate speech Bill: CM Siddaramaiah
content: The Chief Minister said no criminal case would be registered unnecessarily if no provocative speech was made, and questioned the need for the BJP to oppose the Bill

title: Rail ticket prices hike: Modi government leaving no opportunity to loot public, says Kharge
content: The Railway Ministry on December 21 announced a hike in train ticket prices by 1 paise per km for ordinary class beyond a journey of 215 km, and 2 paise per km for non-AC classes of mail/express trains and AC classes of all trains

title: Road connectivity for Perumbalam Island by mid-February
content: Once the bridge is opened, the KSRTC will launch bus services to Perumbalam. Short-distance buses operating from the island will terminate at New South Jetty, while long-distance services will halt near the bridge.

title: BSF personnel abducted by Bangladeshi cattle smugglers
content: Incident happened in Mekhliganj area of district on December 21, morning, and personnel returned to India in evening after BSF took up matter with the Border Guards Bangladesh, says official

title: Indian H-1B visa holders who flew back to renew work permits left stranded
content: The Indian high-skilled workers had appointments cancelled between December 15 and 26, the lawyers said, a period coinciding with the U.S. holiday season

title: Protests in Telangana on Dec 27, 28 opposing move to replace MGNREGA with VB-G RAM G: Minister Seethakka
content: If the Employment Guarantee Act is repealed, there will be no work for labourers in villages, forcing them to migrate and work for corporate entities at low wages, the Minister alleged

title: JSS STU wins CII ‚ÄúExcellence for Women in STEM 2025‚Äù award
content: The award ceremony was held recently in New Delhi, bringing together industry leaders and experts committed to strengthening women‚Äôs participation and leadership in STEM

title: UDF in Kerala inducts P.V. Anvar, C.K. Janu as associate members
content: Kerala Kamaraj Congress led by Vishnupuram Chandrasekharan also inducted. UDF chairman V.D. Satheesan says they have offered ‚Äòunconditional support‚Äô to the front

title: Jaishankar to visit Sri Lanka as Special Envoy of PM Modi on December 23
content: The visit underscores India‚Äôs Neighbourhood First Policy and takes place in the context of Operation Sagar Bandhu launched to address the devastation caused by Cyclone Ditwah

title: Police raid on gambling den in Eluru district, 281 arrested, 130 cars, ‚Çπ32 lakh cash seized
content: ‚ÄúWe arrested 281 gamblers, seized 130 cars, 40 two-wheelers, about 250 mobile phones and ‚Çπ32 lakh cash,‚Äù says Deputy Superintendent of Police

title: Dual murder triggers tension in Andhra Pradesh‚Äôs Palnadu region
content: Preliminary investigation indicated that the murders were the result of long-standing personal rivalry in the village, says Palnadu district Superintendent of Police B. Krishna Rao

title: BJP proposes panel of three names for Tripunithura chairperson‚Äôs post
content: Tripunithura municipality returned a hung verdict in the recent local body polls, with BJP-led NDA emerging as the single largest bloc

title: ‚ÄòTwo namoone‚Äô who flee when serious matter comes up, says Yogi Adityanath; Akhilesh Yadav hits back
content: The Uttar Pradesh CM made these remarks while replying to SP‚Äôs allegations over the illegal trade of codeine cough syrup during the second day of the Vidhan Sabha‚Äôs winter session

title: Guntur spine surgeon receives awards from Indian Orthopaedic Association
content: Dr. Naresh Babu receives the HKT Raza Gold Medal 2024 for Best Spine Research for his study on identifying suitable patients for Endoscopic Spine Surgery

title: Drug peddler escapes from NTR police custody, two arrested
content: 13 grams of MDMA seized, special teams sent to Nellore and Bengaluru to nab other accused, says police

title: International Kite Festival 2026 at Parade Grounds in Secunderabad from January 13-15
content: Kites, hot air balloons and drones to fill Hyderabad skies and periphery for Sankranti 2025; rejuvenated lakes to host festival

title: National Herald case: Delhi HC seeks Gandhis' reply on ED plea against trial court order
content: Delhi High Court‚Äôs notice seeking Gandhis' reply comes as the ED argues the trial court‚Äôs dismissal of its charge sheet is legally flawed

title: Gross errors in SIR exercise conducted by ECI so far in West Bengal: Mamata
content: ‚ÄúThe Election Commission is working only as per directions of the BJP. There are gross errors in the mapping of voters during the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise in State,‚Äù alleges West Bengal Chief Minister

title: All like-minded parties welcome in AIADMK-led alliance: Palaniswami
content: Responding to a query on State BJP president Nainar Nagenthran‚Äôs invitation to Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) leader Vijay to join the NDA, Mr. Palaniswami said any party opposing the DMK could be part of the front

title: SC stays conviction of former Maharashtra Minister Kokate
content: The Bombay High Court, on December 19, had granted bail to Mr. Kokate while suspending his two-year jail term

title: ED raids 21 premises in multiple States in Karnataka‚Äôs crypto fraud case
content: The searches were carried out under the provisions of the Prevention of Money-Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002, in the case registered against 4th Bloc Consultants and other accused

content: "What is shocking to us is that the State of Uttarakhand and authorities are sitting like mute spectators when forest land is being grabbed in front of their eyes. Thus, we initiate a suo motu case,‚Äù says the Supreme Court Bench

title: Humayun Kabir floats new party days after laying foundation for Babri-style mosque in Bengal
content: The MLA of Bharatpur says he would contest the Assembly polls from two seats, Rejinagar and Beldanga in Murshidabad.

title: Maoist arms-manufacturing facility busted in Chhattisgarh‚Äôs Sukma
content: ‚ÄúBased on intelligence inputs, a joint team of 150th battalion of Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) and local police busted illegal weapons-manufacturing unit in forest hills near Meenagatta village on December 22,‚Äù says Superintendent of Police

title: Dense fog disrupts flight operations in northern India
content: Flight operations at Delhi Airport are currently running smoothly, according to a recent advisory;  IndiGo, SpiceJet flights from Srinagar cancelled

title: 2025 Annual Report: Crime cases increase by 15.4% in Rachakonda
content: Overall crime against women increased by 4%. Challenges continue in offences involving children and sexual harassment.

title: Two more convicts in T.P. Chandrasekharan murder case in Kerala granted parole

title: 1984 anti-Sikh riots: Delhi court reserves order against Sajjan Kumar for Jan 22
content: Special Judge Dig Vinay Singh reserved the order for January 22 after the final arguments concluded in the case. Mr. Kumar was produced before the court amid heavy security

title: New Year's Eve cruise to offer glimpse of India's lone active volcano
content: Besides exotic food, there will be music and other activities on board MV Swaraj Dweep to celebrate the New Year

title: Praise the Lord; victory is assured: TVK leader Vijay
content: ‚ÄúAll praise to Allah; praise the Lord; be confident. Good [things] will happen, and victory is assured,‚Äù Mr. Vijay said while participating in the Christmas celebrations organised by his party at Mamallapuram

title: UDF withdraws dawn-to-dusk hartal at Perinthalmanna in Kerala‚Äôs Malappuram
content: Decision after police take into custody five activists of CPI(M) allegedly involved in attack on local office of IUML a day earlier

title: Ernakulam General Hospital in Kerala to conduct its first heart transplant; organ to go to Nepali girl
content: Heart, retrieved from a Kollam native declared brain dead at Thiruvananthapuram MCH following road accident, set to be transplanted to Nepali national Durga Kami, who has been seeking medical help in India for close to a year

title: Cold weather persists in Punjab, Haryana; temperatures stay above normal
content: Chandigarh, the joint capital of both States, recorded a low of 8.3 degrees Celsius, one degree above normal

title: RiNK Initiative by KLE CTIE at the Mundhe Banni Startup Meetup
content: This programme seeks to reverse talent migration by facilitating tech professionals‚Äô return from metros and enabling GCCs, startups, and enterprises to scale in North Karnataka

title: Grassroots outreach, development vision helped BJP win local polls: Chavan
content: Mahayuti alliance of the BJP, Shiv Sena, and NCP on Sunday (December 22, 2025) swept the elections to 288 municipal councils and nagar panchayats, winning 207 posts of presidents in the local bodies

title: Priyank Kharge claims VB-G RAM G act undermines MGNREGA's rights-based framework
content: "Much has been spoken about VB-G RAM G Bill. But beyond everything else, these changes will slowly make scheme untenable and eventually kill idea of a rights-based rural employment guarantee," sasy Priyank Kharge

title: Supreme Court refuses to list urgent plea against PMO offering chadar to Ajmer Sharif Dargah on Dec. 22
content: The lawyer making the mentioning in court said the offer of the ceremonial cloth on behalf of the Prime Minister would send a wrong message

title: MLA urges to administer polio drops to eligible children
content: Chief Executive Officer of Zilla Panchayat Lavish Ordia said that the drive began on December 21 and would continue till December 24 to ensure that all eligible children are administered polio drops compulsorily

title: Forensic report clears actor Shine Tom Chacko of drug use charges
content: The drug case was registered after Shine Tom Chacko created quite a stir by fleeing a hotel in Kochi during a raid conducted by District Anti-Narcotics Special Action Force in April

title: Pregnant woman killed for intercaste marriage in Karnataka; husband, in-laws injured
content: In a case of reported honour killing, a pregnant young woman who had returned to the village few months after her intercaste marriage, was attacked with lethal weapons resulting in her death in the hospital. Her husband and in laws have also sustained injuries.

title: Petrol pump dealers in Manipur threaten to shut operations over extortion demands
content: ‚ÄúDeeply disappointed that the government has taken no concrete action regarding their security, even as a memorandum about it was submitted to Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla on December 10,‚Äù says MPDF

title: Air India‚Äôs Mumbai-bound B777 plane returns to Delhi due to right engine issue
content: The plane, carrying around 335 people, was airborne for nearly an hour before returning to Delhi. The aircraft made an emergency landing

title: Steelers' Metcalf shoves fan during game in Detroit
content: Steelers wide receiver DK Metcalf was involved in an altercation with a fan at Ford Field during the second quarter of Sunday's 29-24 win over the Detroit Lions.

title: Back injury forces Ravens' Jackson from SNF loss
content: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson left Sunday night's game against the Patriots late in the first half because of a back injury. He said he hopes to play Saturday at Green Bay but will first have an MRI on Monday.

title: Lions own loss after late OPI calls: 'It's on us'
content: The Detroit Lions owned their big loss after late offensive pass interference calls, with coach Dan Campbell saying, "It's on us."

title: Maye rallies Pats after last week's 'wake-up call'
content: A week after failing to lead a winning drive against Buffalo, Patriots QB Drake Maye was given the same opportunity Sunday night at Baltimore -- and this time he delivered one of the signature performances of his career to clinch a playoff spot.

title: Sources: Cardinals trade Contreras to Red Sox
content: The Red Sox have acquired first baseman Willson Contreras from the Cardinals in exchange for right-hander Hunter Dobbins and additional pitching, sources told ESPN.

title: Defiant Jags shift narrative, beat 1-seed Broncos
content: After a narrative-changing victory over the top-seeded Broncos in Denver, the Jaguars say they don't want anyone jumping on the bandwagon now.

title: Sources: Chiefs fear Minshew suffered ACL tear
content: One week after losing starter Patrick Mahomes to an ACL tear, Chiefs quarterback Gardner Minshew is feared to also have suffered a torn ACL, sources told ESPN.

title: Crosby leaps Lemieux as Pens' all-time top scorer
content: Sidney Crosby broke Mario Lemieux's franchise scoring record with a goal and an assist in the first period of the Pittsburgh Penguins' 4-3 win over the Montreal Canadiens on Sunday, giving him 645 goals and 1,079 assists for 1,724 points in 1,387 games.

content: The fourth-generation Aggie helped Texas A&M win its first volleyball title in a most improbable fashion.

content: Before the NFL's Saturday slate kicked off, players made sure to put their most fashionable foot forward.

content: Bayern Munich's Michael Olise is wanted by a host of other top European clubs. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Why The Anti-India Rage In Bangladesh Makes Little Political Sense
content: Election time among most of our neighbours inevitably has an anti-India component these days. Such narratives are useful for the politically ambitious.

title: Former Punjab Police Officer Attempts Suicide, Note Blames Online Fraud
content: Punjab's former IPS officer Amar Singh Chahal is undergoing treatment at a hospital after he attempted suicide. He had attempted suicide at his home in Patiala and was rushed to the hospital in critical condition.

title: The Significance Of Khaleda Zia's Son's Return To Bangladesh After 17 Years
content: As Bangladesh descends into an abyss of violence with radical Islamic groups running amok, one of the major political events ahead of the elections scheduled for February is the return of one of the most important figures in Bangladesh politics.

title: Video: MMA Match In Shimla Hospital? When Doctor, Patient Fought Over "Tu"
content: A doctor at Indira Gandhi Medical College (IGMC) in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla has been accused of physically assaulting a patient on Monday.

title: Delhi Private Offices Not Adopting Work-From-Home To Face Action: Minister
content: Ordering closure of all illegal industries, Delhi Environment and Industries Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa on Monday warned of strict action against private companies violating the government's direction to switch to work-from-home (WFH) .

title: Probe Agency Files Chargesheet Against Operators Of Fake 'Earn While You Learn' Scheme
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has filed a chargesheet in a money-laundering case against a Jaipur-based private limited company that operated a fraudulent "earn while you learn" scheme.

title: Aravalli Row In Top Court Again, Activist Writes To Chief Justice, President
content: Lawyer and environmental activist Hitendra Gandhi has written to the Chief Justice of India, asking the Supreme Court to reconsider its decision about Aravalli.-

title: Mother Of 3 Dies By Suicide In Bihar, Husband Alleges 'Goonda Bank' Terror
content: A passbook, some pending instalments and a million questions: Pintu Goswami from Bihar's Muzaffarpur has lost his wife Gudiya Devi, 35, to suicide. The mother of three, he alleges, consumed pesticide after being harassed by recovery agents

title: Khasi, Garo Mandatory In Early Classes As Meghalaya Clears New Curriculum
content: The Meghalaya government has made it mandatory to include Khasi and Garo in the curriculum for children up to Class-1, with the aim to simplify learning and strengthen exposure to local culture, officials said on Saturday.

title: Goa Nightclub Fire: Police Custody Of Luthras Extended By 5 Days
content: A Goa court on Monday extended by five days the police custody of Saurabh Luthra and Gaurav Luthra, owners of the Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub where a devastating fire on December 6 resulted in 25 deaths.

title: Karnataka To Auction Unused Liquor Licenses, Likely To Earn Rs 1,000 Crore
content: Siddaramaiah had proposed the transparent e-auction system in the 2025-26 budget presented on March 7, as part of efforts to mobilise additional resources for the state.

title: Mob Justice In Bangladesh Again: Two Men Thrashed, Paraded For Duck Theft
content: In worrying signs that mobs in Bangladesh are taking law and order into their hands, two men were thrashed, their heads tonsured, and were made to dance in public for allegedly stealing a duck

title: 'Sustainable' Christmas Tree Made From Beer Bottles Sparks Row In Kerala
content: An unconventional Christmas tree in Kerala has triggered protests from the UDF, which claims the idea sends the wrong message.

title: "Work Dispute, Not Blasphemy": New Twist In Hindu Man's Lynching In Bangladesh
content: Days after Hindu factory worker Dipu Chandra Das was set on fire after being lynched in Bangladesh's Mymensingh, his family has claimed that the 27-year-old was killed over workplace rivalry rather than any alleged "blasphemous" remark.

title: Girl Cuts Mao's Portrait From Yuan Notes, Destroying Chunk Of Family's Savings
content: A five-year-old girl's afternoon fun turned into a costly tragedy after she accidentally destroyed a sizable portion of her family's savings.

title: Ex-Nickelodeon Child Star Tylor Chase Spotted Homeless On California Streets
content: A former Nickelodeon actor has been spotted living on the streets of California. Tylor Chase, 36, who portrayed Martin Qwerly on Ned's Declassified School Survival Guide between 2004 and 2007, was seen in Riverside, Los Angeles.

title: Asim Munir Awarded Saudi Arabia's Highest Civilian Honour During Official Visit
content: Pakistan's Chief of Defence Forces, Field Marshal Syed Asim Munir, has been awarded Saudi Arabia's highest civilian honour, the King Abdulaziz Medal of Excellence. Munir is currently on an official visit to the Kingdom.

content: A 68-year-old man was allegedly cheated of Rs 23.5 lakh by cyber fraudsters who threatened him with digital arrest in Maharashtra's Thane district, police said on Monday.

content: Intelligence findings say the so-called "zone-effect" weapon would seek to flood Starlink orbits with hundreds of thousands of high-density pellets, potentially disabling multiple satellites at once.

title: 'I challenge Mamata': Suspended TMC MLA floats new party; Bengal CM hits back
content: Humayun Kabir, a West Bengal MLA, has launched his new political party, the Janata Unnayan Party. This move follows his suspension from the Trinamool Congress. Kabir plans to contest the 2026 West Bengal assembly elections. He aims to challenge Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and has declared his intention to contest from two seats in Murshidabad

title: Star Wars: Is Russia targeting Musk‚Äôs Starlink? Nato makes explosive claim
content: Nato intelligence suggests Russia is developing a novel anti-satellite weapon designed to release thousands of tiny metal pellets, potentially disabling multiple satellites, including Ukraine's vital Starlink constellation. This "zone-effect" weapon could create widespread, uncontrollable space debris, posing a significant threat to all orbital assets. Experts debate its practicality and potential repercussions.

title: Ashes: Should McCullum and Stokes be sacked? Strauss opens up
content: Andrew Strauss says sacking Ben Stokes or Brendon McCullum will not solve England‚Äôs repeated Ashes failures in Australia. The former captain, England‚Äôs last Ashes winner Down Under, believes deeper structural changes are needed. With England 3-0 down again, Strauss warned against knee-jerk reactions and urged reforms to fix a long-standing system problem.

title: B'desh to scale back diplomatic presence in India? What its FM said
content: The ministry of external affairs (MEA) on Saturday had said that about 20-25 youths gathered in front of the Bangladesh High Commission in New Delhi on Saturday and raised slogans, protesting the "horrendous killing" of Dipu Chandra Das, 25, who was lynched to death by a mob in Mymensingh on Thursday.

title: H-1B travel caution: Apple to employees; avoid international trips without a valid visa stamp
content: Tech giants like Apple, Google, and Microsoft are now warning employees about the significant risks of international travel.  US visa stamping delays, stretching up to 12 months due to enhanced screening, mean H-1B visa holders could face extended stays abroad.  Companies urge staff to postpone non-essential trips to avoid being stranded.

title: U19 Asia Cup: Pak PM Sharif announces reward for winners; each player to get PKR 10 million
content: Pakistan Prime Minister Shahbaz Sharif announced a 10 million Pakistani rupees cash award for each U19 player after Pakistan thrashed India by 191 runs to win the U19 Asia Cup. Sameer Minhas starred with a brilliant 172, while Pakistan‚Äôs pacers dominated. Coaches and players praised teamwork, preparation, and collective effort behind the title win.

title: 'No new mining': Amid uproar, Centre clarifies Aravalli order; defends new definition
content: Speaking on the Supreme Court's acceptance of the "new definition" of Aravalli, the minister said: "The ruling recognises and endorses the Government of India‚Äôs sustained efforts to protect the Aravalli range through scientific assessment, strict safeguards and initiatives such as the Aravalli Green Wall Project." Yadav explained that the Aravali range comprises all landforms located within 500 metres of two adjoining hills with a height of 100 metres or more.

title: 'England have had a cockiness': Vaughan rips into Stokes & team; Ashes hammering the trigger
content: England‚Äôs Ashes 2025‚Äì26 campaign ended in disaster as Australia sealed a 3-0 lead within 11 days. Michael Vaughan criticised Ben Stokes‚Äô side for their failed approach, calling the tour ‚Äúhumbling.‚Äù Despite strong efforts from Stokes and Archer, England fell short chasing 435, with Australia dominating throughout and retaining the Ashes comfortably.

title: Meta‚Äôs most-famous employee to students: Do not study computer; focus on core subjects
content: AI pioneer Yann LeCun advises computer science students to prioritize foundational subjects like math and physics over trendy technology courses. He argues that a strong grasp of core principles, often found in engineering disciplines, is crucial for long-term adaptability in the rapidly evolving tech landscape.

title: Life under the river: How the east‚Äìwest metro is redrawing Kolkata‚Äôs daily map
content: Kolkata's new East-West Metro, the Green Line, has revolutionized city travel with its groundbreaking underwater tunnel beneath the Hooghly River. This engineering marvel drastically cuts commute times between Salt Lake and Howrah, offering comfort and reliability. The line is already transforming daily life, easing congestion and connecting twin cities like never before.

title: On this day: Rohit Sharma stamped his authority with 35-ball T20I hundred; set new record
content: Eight years ago today, Rohit Sharma etched his name in T20I history by smashing a joint-fastest century off just 35 balls against Sri Lanka in Indore. This explosive innings, featuring 12 boundaries and 10 sixes, was a highlight of his stellar career before retiring after India's 2024 T20 World Cup triumph.

title: After cutting Amazon stake: Jeff Bezos‚Äô ex-wife donates billions in 2025; 186 groups benefit
content: MacKenzie Scott has donated over $7.1 billion in 2025 to 186 organizations globally, including universities and environmental nonprofits, marking her largest annual giveaway. This significant philanthropic effort, detailed on her website Yield Giving, continues her focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives, with substantial contributions to institutions like Howard University and the UNCF.

title: BrahMos and beyond: How UP is becoming India‚Äôs defence capital
content: India's supersonic prowess is taking flight from Lucknow with the inauguration of a state-of-the-art BrahMos Aerospace Integration and Testing Facility. This 200-acre complex is set to become the epicentre for producing the formidable BrahMos cruise missile, catering to surging domestic and international demand, including significant export orders.

title: Dhurandhar‚Äô box office day 18: Ranveer Singh-starrer slows after Rs 550 cr mark
content: 'Dhurandhar' continues its box office dominance, becoming the biggest second-weekend grosser of all time with Rs 253 crore collected in its second week. The film has now amassed Rs 558.01 crore in India, showing strong performance even into its third weekend.

title: ‚ÄòWon‚Äôt let them become communal labs‚Äô: Why Christmas row erupted in Kerala schools
content: Kerala's Education Minister V. Sivankutty has warned private schools against blocking Christmas celebrations, citing concerns of divisive religious models. He emphasized that schools should foster secular values and unity among students, vowing strict action against institutions promoting narrow communal interests. The minister's remarks followed reports of some schools cancelling festivities.

title: 'Desh ke andar do namune hai': Yogi's veiled swipe at Akhilesh, Rahul; SP chief hits back
content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath targeted Akhilesh Yadav and Rahul Gandhi, calling them "two specimens" who flee the country during discussions. He denied deaths from codeine syrup, stating action will be taken under the NDPS Act and linking the biggest wholesaler to the SP's tenure. Akhilesh Yadav criticized the personal attacks and alleged the racket originated from the Prime Minister's constituency.

title: Who is Brittani? Aaron Rodgers‚Äô wife as Steelers QB marriage mystery deepens
content: Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers has found unexpected peace in his marriage to Brittani.  Unlike his previous public relationships, Brittani values privacy.  Rodgers credits his wife with providing unconditional love and stability.  This new chapter sees a calmer, more focused Rodgers as he navigates his final NFL years.  His teammates and coaches notice the positive change.

title: Bangladesh unrest: After Osman Hadi, another youth leader shot in head
content: Days after the killing of youth leader Sharif Osman Bin Hadi, another prominent youth leader, Motaleb Sikdar, was shot in head on Monday. He was taken to hospital in critical condition. This incident escalates concerns over political violence amidst heightened tensions following Hadi's death, which sparked widespread protests demanding justice.

title: Stock market today: Sensex up over 600 points - top reasons for rally
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Monday extending gains from the last trading session. While Nifty50 went above 26,150, BSE Sensex was up over 600 points.

title: 'A big hug from me': Mandhana touches hearts while replying to Kashmiri fan
content: Smriti Mandhana touched hearts by replying to a young Kashmiri fan after filmmaker Kabir Khan shared her story from Aru Valley. Soon after, Mandhana made history in the first T20I against Sri Lanka by becoming the first Indian woman to score 4,000 T20I runs, highlighting her class on and off the field.

title: Aamir Khan: 25 Years of box office reinvention and risks
content: Aamir Khan, Bollywood's 'Mr Perfectionist', has carved a unique path over 25 years, marked by groundbreaking blockbusters like 'Dangal' and '3 Idiots', alongside notable flops. His career, a blend of artistic risks and commercial success, showcases a filmmaker's vision within an actor's persona. Despite recent setbacks, his influence as a content driver remains significant.

title: Another husband murder in UP: Man hacked to death by wife, her lovers; head missing
content: A chilling murder in Chandausi has shocked residents after a woman allegedly conspired with her lovers to kill her husband. Rahul, a shoe trader, was brutally dismembered, with body parts found scattered. His wife, Ruby, initially reported him missing, but inconsistencies led to her detention along with two others. Evidence suggests the murder occurred at their home.

title: 'If you're a good team, you don't need an Impact Player': Sam Curran
content: England all-rounder Sam Curran is in scintillating form for Desert Vipers in ILT20, leading the run charts and contributing with crucial wickets.  He credits team continuity and enjoyable conditions for their success.  With the T20 World Cup looming, Curran's stellar performances put him firmly in the spotlight, aiming for trophies and continued enjoyment of the sport.

title: IPL 2026: R Ashwin calls Virat Kohli's new teammate an 'absolute steal by RCB'
content: New Zealand pacer Jacob Duffy achieved a historic five-wicket haul in the final Test against the West Indies, securing a series victory. His performance also saw him surpass Richard Hadlee's record for most wickets in a calendar year for New Zealand. Duffy's exceptional 2025 form across formats has earned him high praise.

title: ‚ÄòAnyone who attacks my wife can ... ‚Äô: JD Vance warns against racist, sexist remarks on Usha
content: Vice President JD Vance has strongly condemned racist and sexist attacks targeting his wife, Usha Vance, and declared that ethnic hatred has no place in the conservative movement. He denounced antisemitism and other forms of racial hostility, calling such attacks "disgusting.

title: Watch: Newly elected Telangana leader dons bear costume to tackle village monkey menace
content: A newly elected sarpanch in Telangana donned a bear costume to scare away monkeys plaguing his village.  After traditional methods failed, Kummari Ranjith's unusual tactic aims to provide interim relief while urging the government for a permanent solution to the widespread menace causing crop damage and injuries.

title: Saudi Arabia honours Munir: Pak army chief gets top civilian award
content: Pakistan's Chief of Defence Forces, Field Marshal Syed Asim Munir, received Saudi Arabia's highest civilian honor, the King Abdulaziz Medal of Excellence, during his official visit. The award recognizes his professionalism and role in strengthening ties between the two nations. Munir reaffirmed Pakistan's commitment to Saudi Arabia's security and stability.

title: Vijay Hazare: After India snub, Shubman Gill back in spotlight; Punjab stack firepower
content: Shubman Gill returns to domestic cricket for the Vijay Hazare Trophy with Punjab after being left out of India's T20 World Cup squad.  He aims to regain form in the 50-over competition, supported by teammates Abhishek Sharma and Arshdeep Singh, as Punjab seek a strong title challenge in the domestic 50-over tournament.

title: Watch: Asim Munir says he felt 'divine intervention' during Op Sindoor
content: Pakistan's chief of defence forces, Asim Munir, claimed "divine help" during a military confrontation with India in May. He also urged Afghanistan's Taliban regime to choose between Pakistan and the Tehrik i Taliban Pakistan, stating that Afghans constitute the majority of militants infiltrating Pakistan.

title: How Long To Hold A Stock: Staying invested beats timing; compounding drives long-term gains
content: Enduring market volatility is key to unlocking significant equity returns.  Instead of fixed holding periods, focus on business cycles.  Long-term investors who stay invested through dull and scary phases, like the Titan example, are rewarded with substantial growth.  Missing just a few strong market days can drastically reduce returns, highlighting the importance of time in the market over timing it.

title: India-New Zealand FTA: Zero duty on 100% Indian exports - what the deal means for you
content: India and New Zealand have finalized a Free Trade Agreement, set to significantly boost bilateral trade and investment. The pact promises enhanced market access for goods and services, with New Zealand committing substantial investment.

title: Room heater buying guide: What to know and what not to miss before you buy this winter
content: Winter's chill demands a room heater, but choosing the right one is crucial. Beyond warmth, consider electricity consumption, safety features like overheat protection, and air quality.  Understanding wattage, energy efficiency ratings, and different heater types like oil-filled or ceramic will prevent hefty bills and ensure comfort. Prioritize safety and your specific needs for a cozy winter.

title: T20 WC: Finally Samson's moment of clarity? India's T20 'opener' looks to rise above chaos
content: Sanju Samson's long-awaited T20 World Cup opening spot comes after a decade of uncertainty and a revolving door of wicketkeepers. Despite strong performances, he faced confusion and batting order shifts, highlighting the team management's struggle for consistency in selecting their T20I wicketkeeper and openers.

title: Mumtaz calls Fardeen Khan ‚ÄòHeera Ladka,‚Äô opens up on daughter‚Äôs separation
content: Veteran actress Mumtaz has spoken about her daughter Natasha Madhvani's separation from Fardeen Khan, emphasizing that their bond remains strong. She praised Fardeen as a "heera ladka" and a caring husband, highlighting his visits to Natasha when she was unwell. Mumtaz also described him as a devoted father and expressed her hope for their reunion.

title: National Herald case: Delhi HC issues notice to Sonia, Rahul; seeks reply
content: The Delhi High Court has issued notices to Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, among others, in the National Herald money laundering case. The Enforcement Directorate is challenging a trial court's refusal to take cognisance of its complaint, alleging assets worth ‚Çπ2,000 crore were acquired for just ‚Çπ50 lakh. The matter is scheduled for further hearing in March 2026.

title: Chilling videos found on Bondi attacker's phone shows them training, justifying attack
content: New court documents reveal disturbing allegations about the Bondi Beach terror attack. The accused allegedly threw homemade bombs, including one disguised as a tennis ball, at a Jewish community event before opening fire. The father and son duo are believed to have acted together in a planned terrorist attack.

title: Watch: Pakistan U19 team gets grand welcome; PM Shahbaz Sharif to host reception
content: Pakistan's Under 19 cricket team received a hero's welcome in Islamabad after their convincing Asia Cup final victory over India. The triumph, marked by a large public reception and a victory parade, has drawn praise from Prime Minister Shahbaz Sharif and the PCB chairman, highlighting the significance of this rare junior-level success.

title: How Nicki Minaj went full MAGA with Erika Kirk in tow
content: Minaj appeared alongside Erika Kirk, the widow of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, at the AmericaFest gathering organised by Turning Point USA. During the on-stage conversation, she praised President Trump and Vice President JD Vance, describing them as leaders she admired and as figures young men could relate to. She also mocked California Governor Gavin Newsom using a nickname popularised by Trump, signalling comfort with the language commonly used within MAGA-aligned political spaces.

title: Priorities changed: Will Williamson wear NZ whites again? Test future 'series by series'
content: New Zealand's batting maestro Kane Williamson, 35, hinted at a potential Test retirement after the West Indies series, prioritising family and a flexible playing schedule.  His casual contract allows him to choose national assignments, with significant gaps before potential future series.  Despite nearing milestones, Williamson emphasises team success over personal records.

title: Bangladesh unrest: Hindu worker Dipu Das's lynching sparks outrage in Bengal
content: The lynching of Dipu Das in Bangladesh has ignited protests across Bengal, with Hindu organizations condemning the "barbarism" against minorities.  Das, a Hindu from a lower caste, was allegedly targeted for a promotion, with accusations of social media posts used as a pretext.  Activists are demanding action and a boycott of Bangladeshi goods.

title: Silver price hits record high! White metal crosses Rs 2.14 lakhs per kg
content: Silver reached a lifetime high on Monday, touching Rs 2,14,534 per kilogram on MCX and $68.65 per ounce spot, driven by strong central bank buying, ETF inflows, and industrial demand. Analysts anticipate a potential rise to Rs 2,25,000 by year-end due to supply disruptions and global cues.

title: 'I remember every face': 2016 UP highway gang rape survivors recount years of trauma
content: A survivor of the 2016 Bulandshahr gang rape, now studying law, shared her family's decade-long ordeal of harassment and relocation after the brutal attack. Conviction of five men offers hope, but the trauma and its impact on their lives and livelihoods remain profound.

title: Gold price prediction: What is the price outlook in the coming days?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are poised for a significant surge, potentially reaching ‚Çπ138,000-‚Çπ140,000, according to Manav Modi.  Silver has already seen remarkable gains, exceeding 120% year-to-date.  Despite record highs, investors are advised to buy on dips, with key support levels at ‚Çπ132,000.

title: Ranking the FBS coaching hires: How all 30 moves grade out
content: former Nebraska quarterback Scott Frost returned to Lincoln to save a flailing cornhuskers program . he went 16-31 and was fired early in his fifth season . former Ohio State player and longtime Buckeyes assistant Luke Fickell took the job .

title: 'He just took over': How Mark Fletcher became the engine powering Miami's run
content: Shannon Dawson's game plan was to throw the kitchen sink at Texas A&M . he would run every twist on every play he could imagine until something broke . the score was tied at 3 and both offenses had traded blows in a battle of attrition .

title: Let's overreact to NFL Week 16: Broncos won't be the 1-seed? Macdonald is COY?
content: the pre-Sunday NFL Week 16 games were completely wild and massively consequential . the results feel weightier, mainly because there isn't much time left to fix problems that result from them . if the Buccaneers lose a playoff spot, they will meet again in week 18 .

title: Women's NCAA volleyball Way-Too-Early Top 10 for 2026
content: the transfer portal has yet to take hold in full . many rosters could get a shake up in the coming weeks . this top 10 is based on what we know now and is a little peek into how the run to next season's final four in San Antonio could shake out .

title: Transfer portal: Tracking who intends to move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: 'Tis the szn': Chargers troll Cowboys multiple times after victory
content: the Los Angeles Chargers beat the Dallas Cowboys 34-17 on the road . it's their fourth straight win in a row . the team edited a clip from the 2004 film "The Polar Express" the conductor punches an "L" on a ticket for the cowboys.
